head.title: Tara Mendrzycki and Adam M. Smith

hedline.hl1: Tara Mendrzycki and Adam M. Smith

block.p: Tara Ann Mendrzycki, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward C. Mendrzycki of Bronxville, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Adam Mason Smith, a son of Mr. and Mrs. William Smith of Cranford, N.J. Msgr. James Connolly officiated at the Church of St. Joseph's.

Mrs. Mendrzycki Smith, 26, is a counselor in Mamaroneck, N.Y., with the drug abuse prevention program of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York. She graduated from Duke University and received a master's degree in counseling from Columbia University. Her father is a partner at the New York law firm of Simpson Thacher & Bartlett. Her mother, Catherine Mendrzycki, is the principal of St. Patrick's School, a parochial elementary school in Bedford, N.Y.

Tara Ann Mendrzycki, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward C. Mendrzycki of Bronxville, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Adam Mason Smith, a son of Mr. and Mrs. William Smith of Cranford, N.J. Msgr. James Connolly officiated at the Church of St. Joseph's.

Mrs. Mendrzycki Smith, 26, is a counselor in Mamaroneck, N.Y., with the drug abuse prevention program of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York. She graduated from Duke University and received a master's degree in counseling from Columbia University. Her father is a partner at the New York law firm of Simpson Thacher & Bartlett. Her mother, Catherine Mendrzycki, is the principal of St. Patrick's School, a parochial elementary school in Bedford, N.Y.

Mr. Smith, 26, is a third-year law student at Fordham University. He graduated from the University of Massachusetts. His mother, Ruth Smith, is the executive director of the Westfield (N.J.) Senior Citizen Housing Corporation. His father is a social science teacher at Ridge High School in Basking Ridge, N.J.
